What does the "activationheight" property in the upgrade object represent?
The "activationheight" property in the upgrade object represents the block height at which the upgrade will be activated.
What is the difference between the "chaintip" and "nextblock" properties in the "consensus" object?

The "chaintip" property in the "consensus" object represents the branch ID used to validate the current chain tip, while the "nextblock" property represents the branch ID that the next block will be validated under. This allows the network to transition smoothly between different consensus rules.
What kind of information can be found in the "info" property of an upgrade object?
The "info" property of an upgrade object contains additional information about the upgrade, which can be used to provide more context or details about the upgrade.
